STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 8, 2024
Tishara Price
Macomb County DHHS
44777 N. Gratiot Ave.
Clinton Township, MI, 48036-1362
Re: License #: CP500201269
SI #: 2024SIC0001523
Dear Ms. Price:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243- 9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001523
Special Investigation Intake Date: June 18, 2024
License #: CP500201269
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius LuJuan Starling
Chief Administrator: Tishara Price
Agency Name: MACOMB COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 44777 N Gratiot Ave
Clinton Township, MI 48036-1362
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/20/2024
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
6/18/2024 1:51 PM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
7/11/2024 11:00 AM Documentation Other
8/15/2024 11:00 AM Video Conference Interview
8/22/2024 9:00 AM Other Other
8/23/2024 1:30 PM Video Conference Interview
9/5/2024 1:30 PM Other Other
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code License recommendation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12325
Section • (1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
Description appropriate licensing action consistent with facts contained
in the foster home evaluation and any special evaluations.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency opened an SE and cited a foster parent for moving to a
new residence without notification. A corrective action plan(CAP)
was implemented to continue to allow the foster parent to remain
at the residence without approving the home for licensure as the
homeowner will not allow the home to be licensed. The agency did
not complete timely background checks on persons residing at the
new residence. It is not appropriate for a CAP to be implemented
at a home that is unable to be license.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed on 6/18/2024. There was no
additional information to add.
A TEAM conference was held on 8/15/2024 with the
administrative staff of Macomb DHHS familiar with the
allegation of the foster home and foster parent. The Foster Care
Worker was on annual leave during this time. The Foster
Care/Licensing Supervisor led the conversation regarding the
allegation.
Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor reported the Foster Parent
moved into her brother’s home on 11/25/2023 without the
knowledge of the Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services (MDHHS). She reported Foster Parent failed to have a
discussion with her licensing and foster care workers in advance
of the move and only notified the workers via text messages after
Foster Parent had already moved. She reported Foster Parent
had placement of Foster Child A at the time of her relocation.
Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor said she learned later, on
12/21/2023 from the Licensing Specialist Supervisor that Foster
Parent moved the week of Thanksgiving due to her inability to pay
her rent because the company she was working for went on strike.
Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor said she also learned that
Foster Parent had shared with Licensing Specialist that she was
2

considering a move in October 2024, but did not have any details
about the move or any specific plans or timeframes.
Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor said as soon as she heard
Foster Parent had moved, (12/21/2023) she immediately had the
Licensing Specialist initiate a special investigation.
Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor said the agency offered the
option of licensing the home Foster Parent was currently residing
in, however Foster Parent’s Brother who owns the home was not
in agreement with the licensing process in the beginning. She
said Foster Parent’s Brother later decided to get his home
licensed and attended orientation. She said Foster Parent’s
Brother later reported a lack of interest due to the removal of
Foster Child A from the home in December, 2023. She said on
1/26/2024, Licensing Specialist discovered Foster Parent’s
Brother’s home was unsuitable to be licensed. This came as a
result of a safety alert by DCWL Analyst.
Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor reported the decision to place
Foster Parent on hold and implement a corrective action plan
came after careful consideration of the circumstances, the
excellent care of the children placed in Foster Parent’s home prior
and her ability to work with the foster care staff and parents. She
reported Foster Parent wanted to remain licensed and was willing
to obtain her own housing within 6 months. She said despite the
Foster Parent’s reason for relocating, the Foster Parent’s income
was adequate to live independently, and Foster Parent had no
prior special evaluations. Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor said
the agency sought to prevent a foster home closure because the
agency has a great need for foster parents.
Foster Care Worker 1 (FCW) was interviewed on 8/23/2024.
She reported Foster Parent was a newly licensed home that
opened on 4/3/2023. Foster Parent was licensed for one child
aged 0-2 years old. She said Foster Child A was placed in her
home from 10/27/2023 until his replacement on 12/22/2023. FCW
1 said Foster Parent informed her of her move from her apartment
on 11/25/2023 via text message. She reported she had a
conversation with Foster Parent informing her she could not move
without informing the department beforehand. FCW 1 said she
had no concerns about Foster Parent’s ability of being an
adequate foster parent to Foster Child A that was placed in her
care.
3

FCW 1 reported she went to Foster Parent’s home monthly and
observed no safety concerns. She reported a clearance was not
sought on Foster Parent’s Brother or a safety plan put in place
because this was not her area of expertise, she was unaware of
licensing policies and that Licensing Specialist was informed at
the same time she was informed. She provided no additional
information.
Licensing Specialist (LS) reported a special evaluation was
initiated with Foster Parent on 12/21/2023. He reported Foster
Parent was informed a special evaluation was initiated and the
possible rule that was in violation. He shared similar information
as Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor. He added that Foster
Parent was in violation with Rule 400.9504 Change of residence:
agency notification. He reported he discussed with Foster Parent
the need to inform LS of any anticipated relocations at least 4
weeks prior to the change. LS reported he explained the
corrective action plan that was put in place for Foster Parent. He
did not discuss the reason a CAP was put in place. He did state
that Macomb DHHS administrative team made the decision of
placing the Foster Parent on a CAP.
Documents Reviewed:
• Foster Child A’s case record in MiSACWIS – placement
change dated 10/27/2023 due to maternal grandmother
suddenly passing on 9/29/2023. Placement change to
Foster Parent mentioned in this report dated 10/27/2023.
Home visit occurred on 10/30/2023.
• Foster Parent case record in CWLM. Review the only
special investigation report.
• Special Evaluation #2024C0001205SE. The special
evaluation outlines what the interviewees mentioned in this
special investigation report.
• Special evaluation #2024C0001205SE CAP - basely stated
that Licensing Specialist will go over the details of the
licensing rules in which Foster Parent is in violation with to
ensure a complete understanding of the rules and
expectations of proper reporting. Target date 2/29/2024.
4

Analysis The agency is found in violation with the rule as the appropriate
licensing action of providing a CAP to the Foster Parent was not
consistent with facts contained in the foster home. The foster
home the Foster Parent was living in was unable to be licensed
due to structural and home repair issues. Foster Parent brother
did have a background check as he was the Foster Parent
substitute caregiver.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Special evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327
Section • (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to possible
Description noncompliance with any foster home rule, the agency must
do all the following:
• (a) Submit a special investigation record to the
department’s licensing authority within 5 working days in
the manner prescribed by the department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The agency did not submit a special investigation to the
department’s licensing authority within 5 days of learning of the
allegation.
Investigation Foster Care/ Licensing Supervisor reported Foster Parent
moved into Foster Parent’s Brother home on 11/25/2023 without
the knowledge of the Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services (MDHHS). She reported Foster Parent failed to have a
discussion with her licensing and foster care workers in advance
of the move and only notified the workers via text messages after
Foster Parent had already moved.
Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor reported the following
information regarding timeline:
• Text message sent to Licensing Specialist and Foster Care
Worker 1 from Foster Parent on 11/25/2024, informing
them she had relocated and moved Foster Parent’s Brother
home.
• Foster Care Worker 1 informed Foster Parent she could not
move without informing the department beforehand. Foster
Care Worker 1 stated Licensing Specialist was informed of
the move on 11/25/2024 and she did not move forward with
5

any other notifications or else a special evaluation and/or
removal of Foster Child A would have occurred at that time.
• Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor reported she was
supervising Licensing Specialist from October 2023 to
December 2023. She stated Licensing Specialist was new
to the licensing position and was learning his role. She said
she had supervision with Licensing Specialist on
10/30/2023 and 11/20/2023 due to his primary supervisor
being out on leave. Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor
stated when Licensing Specialist learned of the move on
11/25/2023, he did not share this information with her.
However, he went to the new home of Foster Parent on
11/29/2023 to complete an assessment of the home and
reported there were no safety issues in the home. She said
there was no issue with the hot water tank at that time.
• Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor stated Licensing
Specialist’s primary supervisor returned to work in
December of 2023. She had supervision with Licensing
Specialist on 12/19/2023 and they reviewed cases.
Licensing Specialist shared with his supervisor that Foster
Parent had moved. Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor said
she received a telephone call from Licensing Specialist and
Licensing Supervisor on 12/21/2023 informing her that
Foster Parent had moved, and Foster Child A was in an
unlicensed home. Foster Care/Licensing Supervisor said a
decision was made immediately to open a special
investigation, notify the private agency who had full
responsibility of Foster Child A’s case and ask for Foster
Child A’s immediate removal.
• Licensing Specialist reported a special evaluation was
initiated with Foster Parent on 12/21/2023. He reported he
did not share the information until his primary supervisor
returned from her leave because being new to the position,
he did not know he had to share that Foster Parent had
moved and to open a special investigation. He thought he
only had to complete an assessment of the new home.
Interview with Foster Care Worker 2 (FCW 2) on 8/23/2024,
from another agency who had full responsibility of Foster Child A.
She reported Foster Parent texted her on 11/25/2023, that she
had moved. She said at the time her agency was unaware that it
was not previously approved by Licensing Specialist from
Macomb DHHS. FCW 2 said she heard from Licensing Specialist
on 12/21/2023 via email that a special evaluation was being
conducted on Foster Parent due to her not notifying anyone about
her move before hand to Foster Parent’s Brother home as well as
6

the home conditions. She said after learning of this information
she had a discussion with Foster Care Worker Supervisor 2 (her
supervisor) and Foster Child A was moved from the unlicensed
home the following day 12/22/2024 to another foster home.
Analysis Foster Parent reported to Foster Care Workers 1 and 2 as well as
the Licensing Specialist via text message that she had relocated
to a new address. Upon learning this information Licensing
Specialist did not share the information with the assigned
Licensing Supervisor at that time. He later shared the information
with his primary supervisor when she returned from leave on
12/19/2024. A special investigation was initiated on 12/21/2024
oppose to within 5 working days (11/25/2024) in the manner
prescribed by the department. The agency is found in violation
with this rule.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
10/4/2024
______________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
10/8/2024
______________________________________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
